> The point is, for a system like prevayler, in order to really 
confirm 
> whether something has been persisted or not, you need to shut down 
the 
> JVM, and then re-start and then check whether the object you 
persisted 
> still exists.

But that would be testing Prevayler itself, wouldn't it? I'd rather 
test my own classes, and just assume that the framework works. Until 
proven wrong, I'll gladly believe in their "zero bugs" statement. :)

If you want to test the interaction of your classes with Prevayler, 
then you shouldn't test the end result of the framework - you should 
test the interaction itself. Mock objects might help here. You'll 
need a Mock Prevayler though, which might not be trivial (I'm not 
sure - I just started using Prevayler myself).
